page.title: 04ARTS & CRAFTS, DEERNESS (1)
page.content:
Most women in the parish utilise their spare time to advantage by doing various types of handiwork - {embroidery, patchwork, macrame and {crochet.}The most popular is{hand {knitting}- socks in a mixture of wool and nylon, Aran jerseys in traditional patterns, Nordic sweaters in natural shades, wedding ring shawls in lace patterns using one ply wool fine enough to pull through a wedding ring. {Knitting machines}are used making all over Fair Isle patterned jerseys from Shetland wool.{Original designs}are incorporated in the knitwear which is sold locally and for export. Evidence of these crafts can be seen at local handicraft shows held once every year and competition is very keen to gain honours.
.
